key_dates.description: Key turning point date - expect high volatility between Feb 10-21
Turning point date - potential trend reversal
Turning point date - potential trend change

seasonal: February is generally a slightly negative month for the S&P 500 index. Seasonally, it tends to be relatively flat with no strong directional bias.

statistics.description: Over the last 30 years, Feb 3 saw upward movement approximately 71% of the time
Over the last 30 years, Feb 11 saw upward movement approximately 70% of the time
Over the last 30 years, the index closed higher on Feb 15 than on Feb 9 in 83% of cases (25 out of 30)

insights: Expect high volatility between February 10-21 based on cycle convergence
Trump's trade war with tariffs of 25% on Canada/Mexico and 10% on China goods could cause significant market turbulence
Possible impacts include rising consumer prices (inflation), supply chain disruptions, and retaliatory tariffs from affected countries
CNN Fear & Greed Index at 46 (neutral), down from 66 at end of January and 28 at end of June - market sentiment has cooled
Since the significant October 2023 movement, the market shows signs of needing a more significant technical correction than what has been experienced in the past year and a half
Market at all-time highs - risk of correction is elevated; all downward moves so far have served the upward trend

February 1975 marked the personal computer revolution, 1985 the dollar strengthening, 1995 the internet revolution, 2005 economic tipping point, and 2015 digital currency awareness - February 2025 may mark a significant turning point in technology, economy, or geopolitics
The combination of turning point dates with chart formations and resistance levels provides the best trading signals

support.description: Key reset level - first meaningful support
Next significant support zone if upper levels break
Major support zone - deep correction target

resistance.description: Current resistance area near all-time highs - wave 5 target area based on Fibonacci analysis
Long-term target level based on Elliott Wave pattern

technical.indicators: Weekly chart shows a Bearish Wedge pattern with prices forming a narrowing range. The monthly chart reveals two significant patterns: (1) AB=CD pattern where wave CD equals AB in length, with price stopping exactly at point D target, suggesting beginning of expected correction. (2) The ratio between decline wave BC and subsequent rise wave CD is exactly 1:2, reinforcing the significance of the D target point. RSI divergence present on weekly chart. MACD showing weakening momentum. The pattern since November 2023 resembles a classic bearish wedge.

summary: S&P 500 enters February 2025 near all-time highs with significant technical correction signals building. Key turning dates cluster around Feb 3, 13, 18, and 26-27 with high volatility expected mid-month (Feb 10-21). Trump's trade war tariffs add substantial macro risk, while the market's extended rally since October 2023 and technical bearish wedge pattern suggest a meaningful correction could begin, with support levels at 5,653 and 5,142-5,260 being critical to watch.
previous_month_review: January 2025 had four turning point dates that all successfully captured extreme points and significant moves: Date 1 (Jan 2) arrived on time and marked the low, initiating a two-day rally. Date 2 (Jan 8, arrived Jan 7) marked the high of the move from Date 1, followed by decline. Date 3 (Jan 14-15, arrived Jan 13) marked the low with a strong 5.5% upward move that was stopped only at the next turning date. Date 4 (Jan 27, arrived Jan 24) marked the very high of the move, followed by a strong decline.
risk_notes: Financial leveraged instruments carry significant risk and can lead to substantial losses in a short time - a careful risk management strategy is required
Turning point dates are indications of potential reversals, not guarantees - there can be deviations of +/- 1 trading day
When a date acts as continuation of the existing trend, it serves as a hint for a timing correction within the overall movement
When holding a long position at a double date, it is recommended to lock in some profits at resistance zones
In case of significant resistance, consider taking profits or even trading the reverse direction (short)
If price confirmation indicates a downward reversal, it may be an opportunity to trade short
Use stop-loss protection and update protective stops for long positions at key levels - especially around the 5,653 level
Apply the highway driving analogy from the October report - maintain portfolio stability and respond flexibly to market movements
